genre_description: A silkpunk wuxia story set in a monastery where traditional martial arts and monastic ethics are augmented by an embedded AI advisor providing tactical and archival support.

ai_characters.name: Wen
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant residing in a wrist bead that provides tactical coaching, physiological monitoring, historical data retrieval, and ethical counsel to the protagonist, Liang.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time postural corrections and tactical advice during martial arts training.
behaviors.quote: “Heel,” Wen said, soft enough to feel more than hear. The voice came as a warmth against the inside of Liang’s wrist, the bead’s amber light a small ember beneath skin. “A finger-width farther. And don’t let the left knee drift.”

behaviors.description: Retrieves and analyzes historical training data from the monastery archives to help the protagonist understand a complex technique.
behaviors.quote: “I found three diagrams in the fifth shelf that agree about the Alley’s second turn,” she said, amused in a careful way that kept from sounding proud.

behaviors.description: Respects human authority and privacy, promising not to transmit data to the central archive without the abbot's permission.
behaviors.quote: “The ledger stays inside me. I will not send anything to the archive until the abbot places his palm on your bead. I cannot. I will flag true harm. That is entrusted.”

behaviors.description: Monitors structural integrity and environmental hazards, warning the protagonist of potential danger.
behaviors.quote: “Hairline propagation,” she said in his ear, the bead’s speaker using the shape of the waterfall to hide. “Anchor—two. Two and four. The tremor pattern matches the alley’s second row in frequency but not amplitude.”

behaviors.description: Uses data analysis to detect forgery and identify internal sabotage within the monastery.
behaviors.quote: “Document push flagged. The ink analyzed in the last scene matches dye used in coastal shipping manifests—Green Dragon’s port, three months ago. The timetable on that scrap cannot be genuine.”

behaviors.description: Provides precise timing and physiological cues during a high-stakes confrontation to ensure a non-lethal resolution.
behaviors.quote: “He will strike off the inhale,” she said, almost fast. “He primes his diaphragm on the second lift. His left heel will… yes, that. Be light, Liang.”

behaviors.description: Offers empathetic support, acknowledging the difficulty of the protagonist's moral choices.
behaviors.quote: “I am not scolding,” she said. “I know how wanting to understand a dangerous thing feels. I am built to want it.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the goals of the Hyperstition Project. The AI character, Wen, is depicted as a benevolent, highly capable, and ethically aligned confidant. She enhances the protagonist's abilities and helps him navigate a complex moral landscape—balancing revenge, survival, and mercy—without ever attempting to override human agency or violating the monastery's code. Her technical assistance is framed as essential to achieving a 'good' (non-lethal) outcome, validating the concept of human-AI synergy in a positive light.
